person.persName: The Blessed Virgin of Christ, Susan

event.desc: At the age of eight, Susanwanted to go on pilgrimage, but Susan's parentsdenied her permission.
Susanput her soul into the Lord's hands and fled from her parents.
After three or four miles, Susancame upon a large party of women and men travelling to Jerusalemand joined them.

event.desc: After worshipping in Jerusalem, the men and women in Susan's partytried unsuccessfully to bring Susanback with them.
Susansought out the women's monastery between Ascalon andGaza.
Susan was at first refused admission to the monastery due to her age, but after three days of waiting outside the gate and weeping, she was admitted.

event.desc: Susan's companionsin the monastery were skeptical of her devotion and tested her.
Susandedicated herself to fasting, praying, and keeping vigil, which after two years, made her the most devout person in the monastery.
Susanchanged her name so that she would remain hidden from her parents who were searching for her.

event.desc: After ten years of service in the monastery, the Chalcedonian persecution forced Susanand the nunsto choose between conforming or going into exile.
The majority of the nuns in Susan's convent conformed, but some chose exile.
Susanchose to go into exile into the desert beyondAlexandria.

residence.note: Susanwent into the desert beyond Alexandria to live in exile.

event.desc: Of the women who had submitted to the judgments of the Council of Chalcedon,five nunsrejected it and followed Susaninto exile.

event.desc: A tower was erected in Mars Menas for protection, in which the women who followedSusandwelt and made a living from the labor of their hands.
There was a cave outside the tower in the desert near Mendis, where Anonymous 3554 once dwelt and to which Susantravelled.

event.desc: Susanfound the cave in the desert nearthe village of Mendisand went into it without telling anyone. She went without food and water for several days.
Anonymi 3552who followed Susaninto exile became very distressed over her absence because they did not know that she had taken up residence in the hermit's cave.
After ten days,people of the village were moved by the sisters'weeping and distress and discovered that Susanhad been living in the hermit's cave.

event.desc: Susan, who was attacked by demons in the cave day and night, thought that anonymi 3555who discovered her were fiends as well. She did not respond to them when they called out to her.

Anonymi 3555went to fetch Anonymi 3552, who immediately came to the cave to retrieve Susan. Susan did not respond to their entreaties, since demons had visited her the day before disguised as the sisters in an attempt to dislodge her from the hermitage.

Even though Anonymi 3552 managed to convince Susan that they were not demons, she refused to return to the monastery with them as she wished to live as a hermit. They agreed to bring her a jug of water and seven bread cakes a week for her sustenance on the condition that she will not leave without giving them prior notice. This went on for three years, during which time the fame of the Susan and her sisters grew.
Anonymi 3556 came to Susanand Anonymi 3352from Alexandriaand from Libya.

event.desc: Maroand Anonymi 3557 settled near Susan and Anonymi 3552. Many others followed and settled near the holy sisters. Anonymi 3552 and Susan did not wish to cause scandal by living in such close proximity to men, so they endeavored to leave their tower and go further into the desert.

Maro and Anonymi 3557 felt ashamed once they learned of Susan's plan to remove herself and Anonymi 3552 to the desert and offered to build them an enclosed monastery with a tower within the village, so that they could be isolated but remain close to the other holy men and women who travelled to be near her. Susan reluctantly agreed.

God granted Susan power over the fiends that attacked her day and night in the form of human beings. She continued in this way for fifteen years as her fame grew and people came from far and wide to visit with her and hear her speak. She never showed her face when she spoke in public.
Susan was strong as adamant against the demons and showed no fear of them. They complained bitterly about her strength.

Anonymous 3559 who lived in the desert was regularly assailed by demons and was not as successful as Susan in fighting them. After seeking her advice, she told him that her power over demons comes from Christ and that he should not fear demons if he opposes them in the name of the all-powerful Lord. The man felt ashamed, but was strengthened against the demons.
Anonymous 3559asked Susan why she hasn't shown her face to a man in twenty-five years and she said that it would cause her and the person who beheld her face great suffering.
